sorular.soru: Which lines should you follow here?

feedback.metin: During roadworks, temporary yellow lines are often applied in addition to the existing white lines. The temporary yellow lines then apply, and the speed limit is often lowered to protect road workers.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The box being transported is covering the gear lever, which means the driver cannot properly shift gears. Even if the car is automatic and changing gears is not required, you still need to be able to reach the gearbox easily. Cargo that impedes your driving is prohibited, so you cannot drive like this.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to turn left here?

feedback.metin: This traffic controller is giving a stop signal for the traffic approaching from behind. You may turn left and right here and drive straight on.

sorular.soru: What are you being warned of here?

feedback.metin: You are being warned of low-flying planes. This sign is usually seen near airports.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the following cars in the funeral procession?

feedback.metin: Cutting through funeral processions is prohibited. However, follower cars in a funeral procession may not drive through red lights, even if the hearse has already entered the intersection at a green light. Therefore you are not required to give right of way to them. Make sure the follower cars do, in fact, wait at the red light. The drivers of these vehicles may be emotional and therefore, less attentive to traffic.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum length of an LZV.

feedback.metin: LZV stands for "lang zwaar voertuig (long heavy vehicle). These can be up to 25.25 metres long and special rules apply to these vehicles. For example, they are not allowed to drive on all roads as their length can cause additional inconvenience due to their limited manoeuvrability.

sorular.soru: Should you give this pedestrian the opportunity to cross?
cevaplar: No, this is not mandatory but it is considered preferable.

feedback.metin: The person on crutches falls under the category 'person with decreased mobility'. You are therefore required to give this person right of way. The fact that there is a tram stop with a platform is not important here.

sorular.soru: Until which point are you allowed to return to the main road while driving in an exit lane?
cevaplar: Until the end of the block marking.
Until you have reached the gore separating the roads.
Until the first arrow on the road surface.
sorular.dogruCevap: Until the first arrow on the road surface.

feedback.metin: If you are driving in an exit lane with which you will leave the main carriageway, you may return to the main carriageway until there are arrows on the road surface. Once there are arrows on the exit lane's road surface, you are not allowed to enter the main carriageway even though there is still a block marking on the road surface. This is particularly to prevent drivers from using the exit lane to pass traffic jams on the right-hand side of the road and then merge again further down the road.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to use a child restraint system when transporting a child who is 1.25 metres in length?

feedback.metin: When you transport a person under the age of 18 years and less than 1.35 metres in length, using a child restraint system is mandatory. A child who is 1.25 metres in length should therefore be transported in a child restraint system. Normally, a booster seat is used in this case.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: Stopping on the right-hand side of the road is prohibited. You are allowed to stop on the left-hand side of the road.

sorular.soru: What colour should the dipped headlights emit?

feedback.metin: Dipped headlights, like full-beam headlights and sidelights, should emit white or yellow light.

sorular.soru: Does a trailer have to be equipped with indicators?

feedback.metin: A trailer or caravan must also be equipped with properly functioning rear indicators. These may only be red or amber.

sorular.soru: Does the driver of a towed car need to have a valid driving licence?

feedback.metin: If a car breaks down, you may tow it to the garage, for example. Use a sturdy tow rope. The space between the two vehicles may not exceed 5 metres. The drivers of both vehicles must have a valid driving licence. Please note that the towed car may be more difficult to drive because the power brakes and power steering do not work. Also, do not forget to turn the key to ignition on. Otherwise the steering wheel will lock.

sorular.soru: What should you take into consideration here?
cevaplar: That the cyclist may swerve suddenly.
That you may have issues with aquaplaning.
That the pedestrian may cross unexpectedly.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the cyclist may swerve suddenly.

feedback.metin: You are about to pass a cyclist. However, he is approaching a puddle on the cycle lane. Chances are that he will want to ride around it and will enter your lane for this. Keep this in mind by staying behind the cyclist until they have passed the puddle.

sorular.soru: In what situation should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: Relative to you, the pedestrian is coming from the left (situation A) or the right (situation B) on the intersecting road. They are not on the same road as you. You are approaching priority triangles. These mean: give way to drivers on the intersecting road. Because a pedestrian is not a driver, you do not have to give way to them.

sorular.soru: Are you overtaking correctly this way?

feedback.metin: You are maintaining enough lateral distance while overtaking. When overtaking or passing balance vehicles such as cyclists, mopeds, and snorfietsen, it is wise to maintain a lateral gap of approximately one to one and a half metres.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: Overtaking in foggy weather is not safe because of limited visibility. If overtaking is not safe, it is not allowed.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on while driving?
cevaplar: Stop immediately in a safe place.
Drive to a garage as soon as possible.
Schedule a maintenance appointment at a garage.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop immediately in a safe place.

feedback.metin: This light warns of low brake fluid, worn pads, ABS problems, or an activated parking brake. Stop immediately in a safe location. First, check the parking brake and brake fluid. If this does not resolve the problem, contact the breakdown service.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to these pedestrians?

feedback.metin: These pedestrians want to cross via a crossing marked with canalisation stripes. In this case, you are not required to give way. Pedestrians only have right of way when using an official pedestrian crossing (also called zebra crossing).

sorular.soru: Your passenger car has broken down. Are you parked well?
cevaplar: No. You must park as close to the cycle path as possible.
Yes, you are parked in the right place.
No. You must park on the cycle path.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You must park as close to the cycle path as possible.

feedback.metin: You are parked right next to the carriageway. This is unsafe and may inconvenience other drivers. If there is enough space, as in this situation, you must park your car more to the right.

sorular.soru: Can the driving licence contain a code that stipulates that you must always wear glasses when driving a passenger car?

feedback.metin: On the driving licence, certain restrictions can implemented with codes. This can also be a code that requires you to wear glasses while driving. If you do not wear glasses while driving, the driving licence is not valid at that time.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with the airbags disabled?

feedback.metin: Airbags are not part of the permanent requirements of a vehicle. This means that you are allowed to drive with your airbags disabled. It is, of course, unsafe to do so in most cases.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake like this?

feedback.metin: Hatched road markings are a part of the carriageway on which slanted stripes are painted. Hatched road markings are often found in road narrowing where the number of lanes is reduced. You are not allowed to drive on hatched road markings.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on an autoweg in a built-up area with a speed limit of 50 km/h.

sorular.soru: Should you expect brommobielen on the carriageway?

feedback.metin: You can expect brommobielen on the carriageway. You are outside a built-up area, as indicated by the fact that the priority road sign is positioned after the side road. Brommobielen are allowed to drive inside and outside built-up areas, as long as this is not prohibited by signs. Brommobielen are not allowed to drive on, for example, autowegen or motorways.

sorular.soru: You want to follow the main road to the left. Should you indicate direction?

feedback.metin: The B-5 sign in combination with the supplementary plate indicates that you are approaching an intersection where the main road bends to the left. If you want to continue on this main road, you have priority over drivers from the side roads. You must indicate left because you are turning left.

sorular.soru: Your windscreen wiper is broken. Are you allowed to drive in good weather?

feedback.metin: Every vehicle must meet the permanent requirements. This means that your vehicle may not have any serious defects and may not endanger safety. You may not drive with a defective windscreen wiper or missing wiper fluid because this gives a high risk of poor visibility in weather conditions such as rain, frost, but also in dry weather. The dust on the windscreen reduces visibility, especially in sunny weather. In addition, a window can always get dirty, for example, due to bird droppings or mud splashing from the road surface.

sorular.soru: What is road-banking?
cevaplar: One side of the road is higher than the other.
Sagging of the carriageway due to heavy vehicles.
The height difference between the carriageway and the verge.
sorular.dogruCevap: One side of the road is higher than the other.

feedback.metin: Road-banking means that one side of the road is higher than the other. This is especially the case when cornering. A positive road banking angle means that the inside bend is lower than the outside bend. When the road banking angle is negative, it is the other way round. Positive road banking has a positive influence on road holding.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: There is an obstacle on your side of the road. To pass this object, you must make an important lateral movement. This is a special manoeuvre. As with any special manoeuvres you have to give way to all other traffic. So you have to give way to the cyclist.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: It is not prohibited to park on the left side of a carriageway on a one-way street. The E-1 sign only indicates a parking ban on the side where the sign is placed. In this case, you are allowed to park here.

sorular.soru: Which part of the road is referred to as the carriageway?

feedback.metin: Part C is the carriageway. The carriageway is any road section intended for vehicles in motion, except for cycle and moped paths. Cycle lanes do belong to the carriageway. Part A has no name, part B is the lane.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly to turn left?

feedback.metin: This is a complete one-way street. This means that no driver from the other side is allowed to drive into the one-way street. If you want to turn left, you have to pre-sort at the left-hand side of the road as much as possible.

sorular.soru: Which vehicle is not a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages are all vehicles that are propelled by means of a motor. It may not be moved along rails (such as a train, metro or tram). Bicycles with pedal assistance are also not motor carriages. Note: Trolley buses and speed pedelecs are classed as motor carriages!

sorular.soru: Does the parking disc have to be placed behind the windscreen?
cevaplar: No. This can be done behind any window, provided it is clearly legible.
Yes. Any other place is prohibited.
No. This is also allowed behind the rear window.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Any other place is prohibited.

feedback.metin: If you need to use a parking disc, it is mandatory to place it behind the windscreen. This is prohibited behind the rear window or behind a side window, even if it is easy to read.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the tractor here?

feedback.metin: The F-3 sign means lorries are prohibited from overtaking motor vehicles, so you may overtake the tractor here.

sorular.soru: Can you use the horn to greet people?

feedback.metin: Using a sound signal is only allowed in threatening situations. Using the horn for anything else, such as to greet or say goodbye to someone, is prohibited.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you drive into a fog bank?
cevaplar: Brake immediately and increase following distance.
Release the accelerator and increase the following distance.
sorular.dogruCevap: Release the accelerator and increase the following distance.

feedback.metin: Under normal road and weather conditions, you can maintain a following distance of 2 seconds. In bad weather conditions, such as heavy rainfall or fog banks, you must adjust your speed and keep a longer following distance of 3, 4 or sometimes even more seconds. Do not brake hard immediately, but release the accelerator and slowly reduce your speed.
